result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik E Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay Restitution TBD - State has 60 days to get the amount for funeral expense of the victim to the Court.

Per restitution order filed 6/29/15: Restitution determined to be $3,713.89.

Pay costs and DNA Surcharge. 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Not eligible for challenge or substance abuse programs
Defendant not to have any contact with the family of victim Jordan Peterson, Except for Letter of apology, which is to be given to Agent first.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately. 
 Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Have no contac with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs.
Submit a DNA sample.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with any an all treatments as recommended by the Compass assessment and deptartment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

1:57 p.m. Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Erik E Olsen in custody. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have recieved the PSI report and DOC Memo and no corrections needed.  Victim notification was complied with.  There are no victims present today.
ADA Knaapen makes sentencing statements and recommends a 10 yrs Prison Sentence at 5 yrs Incarceration and 5 yrs Extented Supervision.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing statements and recommends a Intreatment program and 4 to 5 yrs Extended Supervision.
Defendant makes apologetic statements.
Court summarizes the facts of the case and reads victim's (father) statement.

BTC:********************PRISON*************

3 1/2 yr Incarceration & 6 1/2 yrs Extended Supervision.
Not eligible for challenge or substance abuse programs
Defendant not to have any contact with the family of victim Jordan Peterson, Except for Letter of apology, which is to be given to Agent first.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately. 
 Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Have no contac with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs.
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with any an all treatments as recommended by the Compass assessment and deptartment.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay Restitution TBD - State has 60 days to get the amount for funeral expense of the victim to the Court.
Pay court costs, DNA surcharge.
Pay 25% prison account.
Submit a DNA sample.
Pretrial incarceration credit 569 days against the 3 1/2 yrs confinement.

Written Determination copied for the Defendant.
Parties keep their respective copies of the PSI report.
Sentencing Memorandum dated 6/5/15
Letters in support of the defendant from: Scott Olsen, Sarah Olsen, Debra Olsen
Sentencing hearing at 06-09-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Anne Renc and Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:16 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen files an Amended Information.
Defense Attorney has received a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 (amended) - No contest
Amended Information will need to be Re-amended to show the victim as Jordan Peterson.  **Court amends on the Amended Information.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered.
Sentencing set for June 9, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. for 1.5 hrs.
Bond is revoked.
PSI to be completed by May 29, 2015 and provided to counsel to prepare for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing held 1/17/14
Plea hearing on March 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Potential Witnesses filed by Atty Ryan Drenger and Atty Anne Renc
filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc
Defendant's Summary of Expert Witness Testimony filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc

Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Erik E Olsen in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:10  a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Decisions regarding defenses' request to admit 3rd party culpability. 

Court states his findings. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will allow defense's request.
Decision on February 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler and attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Erik E Olsen in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:12 am. Court calls case.
Court states appearances.
Motion to Compel & Motion to Admit Evidence of Third Party Culpability. 
Atty Drengler indicates there is a motion to change venue held open.
Atty Drengler indicates that the motion to compel is still an issue.
Atty Knaapen indicates this is an oversight and has no problem in providing the information.
Court asks Mr. Drengler what is the specific information he is requesting.
Atty Drengler makes statements. 
Court asks if the defense is seeking information on Charles Phillips Moore file.
Atty Drengler concurs.
Atty Knaapen makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Motion to Compel is granted. Information should be granted to the defense within 10 days of today's date.

Atty Drengler makes statements in regards to Motion to Admit Evidence of Third Party Culpability
Court questions Atty Drengler in regards to time and circumstances.
Atty Drengler responds.
Court questions Atty Drengler in regards to Third Party's time back at the residence.
Atty Drengler responds.
Court questions Atty Drengler in regards to Third Party's purchase of controlled substance.
Atty Drengler responds.
Court makes statements.
Atty Drengler responds.
Court makes statements.
Atty Knaapen replies.
Atty Knaapen cites case law.
Court questions Atty Knaapen.
Atty Knaapen responds.
Atty Drengler replies.
Court questions in regards to Kasper.
Atty Drengler responds.
Court questions in regards to number of roommates.
Atty Knaapen makes statements.
Court questions Atty Drengler.
Atty Drengler responds.
Court is reviewing notes taken.
Court questions Atty Knaapen in regards to Mr. Peterson being in the defendant's residence on other occassions.
Atty Knaapen responds.
Court questions Atty Knaapen in regards to the controlled bye.
Atty Knaapen reads from file.
Court questions as to what the coroner's opinion was as to time of death.
Atty Knaapen reads records.
Atty Renc makes statements.
Court wants to organize facts and timelines before making decision on the record.
Matter is adjourned.  Decision scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Compel Discovery filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc
Defendant's Notice of Expert Witness filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc
Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Evidence of Third Party Culpability filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc
Amended Scheduling Order /s/ TTF 11/26/14

Motion hearing on February 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
    Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on April 13, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Evidence of Third Party Culpability filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc

Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler and Anne Renk. Atty Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:09  Court calls case, and states appearances.  Court states this was put on with short notice. Court states this case is Atty Knaapen's case, who is out sick.  There was a Pretrial earlier this week in chambers.  Atty Drengler makes statements regarding the pretrial, and states there alot of facts that they were not given, and therefore they are requesting additional time for discovery, and have the Jury Trial adjourned.  Defendant is aware of the request for an adjournment, and is in agreement.  Atty Molepske states the victim's family is aware of the request to adjourn the Trial.  Atty Molepske states they should be able to get the witnesses here for the tenative date in April.  Atty Drengler states there is one final Motion that was pending upon this being adjourned, that will be filed today.

BTC:  Court will schedule a Final Pretrial Conference for March 30, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  Court will schedule a Motion Hearing for February 13, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.  The new trial date is April 13 through April 17, 2015.

Atty Molepske is not sure if Atty Knaapen has any additional Motions to be filed.  Court will extend the time for Motions to be filed by December 12, 2014.
Motion hearing on November 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial filed by Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc
Copy of letter from Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc dated 05/09/14 in re: Discovery

Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler and Anne Renc. Defendant Erik E Olsen in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion for Change of Venue/Venire

Atty Drengler makes arguments in support of his motion. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 
Atty Drengler makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court will take no action on the motion at this time.  

Atty Molepske questions the Court.

BY THE COURT: 
Motion for Change of Venue is denied at this time.  

Atty Drengler indicates there is additional discovery that was requested in May.  Asks the Court to set a deadline for the new discovery. 
Court questions Atty Molepske. 
Atty Molepske makes statements.  The request is in the process of being complied with. 
Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler makes statements.  

BY THE COURT:  Court orders the State provide, if the item is in their possession, to provide them to defense by 10/21/2014 and or an explanation that they do not have the items.
Scheduling Order /s/ TTF 04/28/14
Motion hearing on October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 8, 2014 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 24, 2014 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Exhibits #1 thru #3 (all exhibit's are COPIES)
Preliminary Hearing
Arraignment on February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erik E Olsen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc. Defendant Erik E Olsen in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Drengler requests sequestration of the State's witnesses.  
Atty Knaapen requests Detective Lawrynk be present as the Court Officer.  
BY THE COURT: 
Court so orders.  

S. Rifleman is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff. 
Atty Knaapen moves for the admission of Exhibit #1.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #1 is received. 
Cross exam by Atty Renc. 
8:43 a.m.  Witness is excused.

Court will take a recess until 9:00 when the next witness will be available to testify by telephone. 

9:03 a.m.  Court is back in sessions.  All parties appearances remain the same.  Exhibits #2 & #3 are marked on behalf of the plaintiff. 
Dr. R. Corliss is sworn by the Court. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
Counsel stipulate to the Doctors CV. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #2 is received. 
Cross exam by Atty Drengler. 
Re-direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
9:50 a.m.  Witness is excused. 
Atty Knaapen moves for the admission of exhibits #2 & #3. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibits #2 and #3 are received. 

9:51 a.m.  J. Lawrynk is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
10:12 a.m.  Cross exam by Atty Renc. 
10:22 a.m.  Witness is excused. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information at this time. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Atty Ryan Drengler and Atty Anne Renc appointed

Defendant Erik E Olsen appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Atty Isherwood states Atty Drengler should contact ADA Knaapen for date on Preliminary Hearing.
Bond continued.

ADDRESS INFO for Erik E Olsen
Current: 317 East North Lake St, Hancock, WI 54943 United States  (Effective: 01-06-2014)
Prior: 645 2nd Blvd Private, Hancock, WI 54943 United States

Court calls case at 10:54 AM.
ADA  Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
This is a Riverside Hearing.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.
Atty Drengler appears in the courtroom, on behalf of Defendant.

ADA  Isherwood states facts for anticipated charges of First Degree Reckless Homicide.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State addresses the Court regarding bond.
State requests $100,000 cash bond. If bond posted, absolute sobriety and participate in pretrial supervision program.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court. Defendant will be appointed an attorney. Will reserve bond discussions at a later time.


Initial Appearance Scheduled for: December 30, 2013   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with any members of Jordan Peterson's family. This is a condition of confinement as well.
Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant and Return of Officer
